chapters.title: Introduction
chapters.text: The profit margin ratio compares profit to sales, expressed as a percentage

chapters.title: Use
chapters.text: Companies use the profit margin ratio to express how well they are handling finances, including how much the business is making, general health of the business, and problems associated with the business

chapters.title: Forumla
chapters.text: Ratio of a company’s profit (sales - all expenses) / revenue

chapters.title: Example
chapters.text:
Example: $800,000 revenue

($200,000) cost of goods sold

$600,000 gross profit

($400,000) other expenses

$200,000 net income

Gross margin: $600,000 / $800,000 = 75%

Net margin: $200,000 / $800,000 = 25%
